intro: Chaetogastra lepidota, commonly known as the silky chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, soft leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
